result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Bruckner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 14-CM-42, 14-CF-61 & 14-CF-69.  Probation agent to contact the Court to set up probation review hearing about 60-90 days after defendant is done serving jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

No contact with victims and co-defendants, C.M., B.V., B.V., M.W., T.S.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full)
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Restitution has been paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Bond is no longer in effect.
Change of Attorney

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State would like to resolve all 7 pending files globally.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:30 pm.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court, in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, issuance of warrant. Defendant's mom got a phone call from an officer telling her that Defendant's March 10 court date was voided, so he thought he didn't have to go. State advises of additional incident with April 7 court date, requests cash bond. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/10/14, 10:00.
